metadata.Title: CVE-2022-41861 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - medium
metadata.Description:
A flaw was found in freeradius. A malicious RADIUS client or home servercan send a malformed abinary attribute which can cause the server to crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-41861` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

freeradius - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1+esm1
freeradius-common - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1+esm1
freeradius-iodbc - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1+esm1
freeradius-krb5 - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1+esm1
freeradius-ldap - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1+esm1
freeradius-mysql - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1+esm1
freeradius-postgresql - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1+esm1
freeradius-utils - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1+esm1
libfreeradius2 - 2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: freeradius package in esm-infra/xenial was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.2.8+dfsg-0.1ubuntu0.1+esm1').
